sep.gaia.resources

Class Cache<R extends DataResource>

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.gaia.resources.Cache<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    Q - The type of the queries the cached resources should be associated to.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    POICache, TileCache, WeatherCache, WikipediaCache

    public abstract class Cache<R extends DataResource>
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for keeping resources in memory and accepting requests for them. Each instance has a limit of resources it will maximally manage. If the count of resources exceeds this value, resources are picked to by removed, according to a specific removal-strategy.
    Author:
    Johannes Bauer (Spezifikation: Matthias Fisch)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Cache()
      Initializes the cache without a limitation for the count of contained entries.
      Cache(int maxEntries)
      Initializes the cache limiting the count of resources to cache at maximum.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      void clear()
      Removes all entries from the cache.

      Returns the element mapped to key.
      java.util.Collection<R> getAll(java.lang.String key)
      Returns the collection of resources associated with key.
      int getMaxEntries()
      Returns the maximum count of key-resources-associations permitted in cache.
      void setMaxEntries(int maxEntries)
      Sets the maximum count of key-resources-associations permitted in cache.
      int size()
      Returns the number of associations between a key and a resource currently cached.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cache

        public Cache()
        Initializes the cache without a limitation for the count of contained entries.

      • Cache

        public Cache(int maxEntries)
        Initializes the cache limiting the count of resources to cache at maximum.
        Parameters:
        maxEntries - The count of resources this cache should manage at maximum.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public R get(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the element mapped to key. If a collection of resources was associated with the key only the first will be returned. In this case use getAll() to get the whole collection.
        Parameters:
        key - The key the resource is mapped to.
        Returns:
        The resource mapped to key or null if there is none.

      • getAll

        public java.util.Collection<R> getAll(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the collection of resources associated with key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key the collection is mapped to.
        Returns:
        The collection of resources mapped to key or null if there is none.

      • add

        public boolean add(R resource)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource to be added to the cache.
        Returns:
        True, if the resource was successfully added, else not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if resource is null or the dummy-flag in the resource is set and it is not a valid resource.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all entries from the cache.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of associations between a key and a resource currently cached.
        Returns:
        The number of elements cached.

      • getMaxEntries

        public int getMaxEntries()
        Returns the maximum count of key-resources-associations permitted in cache.
        Returns:
        The maximum count of key-resources-associations

      • setMaxEntries

        public void setMaxEntries(int maxEntries)
        Sets the maximum count of key-resources-associations permitted in cache.
        Parameters:
        maxEntries - The maximum count of key-resources-associations permitted in cache.
